intro: Draba rhodantha, commonly known as the pink rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb with basal rosettes of dark green, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. Native to alpine and arctic regions of Europe and Asia, it thrives in rocky and gravelly soils. Its compact size and vibrant floral display make it a notable species in its ecological niche.
